6ba643dd1744c0733e5befe047d6025f (11:40): anyone has a clue of what could make this error happen when building for android native ui: res/values/strings.xml:1: error: Error parsing XML: no element found

59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (11:40): lightning
3d61aa0f6fc12097b6e055d41633e8b4 (11:40): i.e. why do you have to not have an account installed?
12505cfdc29ad327761a7eeeaa69423b (11:40): cd793a5fe2e605faf07ef547fc2e02b0: Yep, got it
12505cfdc29ad327761a7eeeaa69423b (11:40): err, will get it tomorrow
3d61aa0f6fc12097b6e055d41633e8b4 (11:41): 59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc: you can just create a dummy rss account

59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (11:41): okay, that'll do
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (11:41): was hoping there was a pref or something
3d61aa0f6fc12097b6e055d41633e8b4 (11:41): but I don't think we've got any way of the account wizard being disabled
3d61aa0f6fc12097b6e055d41633e8b4 (11:41): well basically if you don't have an account, then TB is broken ;-)
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (11:41): yeah that figures
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (11:43): that's got rid of it, ta

1e0b712280576b3bdc2687ea68b28af6 (12:06): mbrubeck: pong
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:13): I'm presuming the inbound bustage was another "whoops forgot to hg add XYZ"
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:14): wonders if there is an easy way to stop mercurial allowing push operations with unversioned files in the working directory
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (12:15): great, so we have absolutely no test that checks whether nssckbi is loaded
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:15): (since this seems to happen quite a bit)
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (12:18): 54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912: maybe a safe_push script could help, that does some magic checks before the actual push
d9937775cc729ee85cdcc70da7dad6b1 (12:18): not forcing... but better than nothing
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (12:19): it would probably make more sense at commit time
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (12:19): or qrefresh
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:19): plus it could do the commit message hook stuff locally too, to save the aggravation of hitting it on push
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:19): on qfin might be a good time
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (12:23): qref and commit are better. qfin is already too late
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:23): yeah but qref would mess with people's workflow
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:24): [mq] my temp patch
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:24): "Sorry no bug number blah blah"
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:24): Hmmm looks like th inbound android bustage wasn't that cset
54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912 (12:24): goes to get tea to wake up a bit
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (12:25): 54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912: i was more thinking about the "hey, you may have forgotten this file" warning on qref
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (12:44): 54d718f6cca21e66ee5a5e3bfd001912: someone already wrote a commit hook, but I don't have it handy
282bf0c99ea80e1e754fa7af6fc333cd (12:59): I think it's my bug filing day... 10 so far, and only 1 related to my current work

e6ea7127a6d17ec96d622e21336396ba (13:16): hi guys, where is goDoCommand specified as referenced in http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/prompts/content/commonDialog.xul#25 ?

e6ea7127a6d17ec96d622e21336396ba (13:16): oh, actually I know that.. but where does http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/content 8684147451a6cc3b92142c6f4b78e61calOverlay.js#97 go? (the doCommand)
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (13:18): e6ea7127a6d17ec96d622e21336396ba: see para 2 of https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XUL/command
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (13:20): e6ea7127a6d17ec96d622e21336396ba: so yea, when looking at what goDoCommand should do, search for its command ID :-)
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (13:20): http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/search?string=cmd_selectAll
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (13:31): 51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f: actually that page has nothing to do with goDoCommand
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (13:33): e6ea7127a6d17ec96d622e21336396ba: as I recall, goDoCommand('cmd_selectAll') ends up calling something in nsGlobalWindowCommands
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (13:33): b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd: well it mentions goDoCommand for <xul:command> relation
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (13:33): but yes, cmd_selectAll does call into Cpp code
e6ea7127a6d17ec96d622e21336396ba (13:35): b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd: alright, thanks
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (13:36): 51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f: yeah, that's just plain incorrect :-(
72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d (13:36): bonjour
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (13:36): b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd: my understanding/testing showed it to also work that way with <xul:command>'s
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (13:36): O well
e6ea7127a6d17ec96d622e21336396ba (13:40): if I see it correctly, cmd_selectAll ends up here: http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/dom/base/nsGlobalWindowCommands.cpp#642
